literal_meaning: To beat the drum and leave the stick.
figurative_meaning: To start something and not finish it.
example: He often starts projects but never completes them; he đánh trống bỏ dùi.

figurative_meaning: To be lost or without direction.
example: After losing his job, he felt like he was lênh đênh trên biển cả.

literal_meaning: Jump when the water reaches your feet.
figurative_meaning: To act only when it's too late.
example: He always waits until the last minute; nước đến chân mới nhảy.

idiom: Cá không ăn muối cá ươn
literal_meaning: Fish that don't eat salt will spoil.
figurative_meaning: Without discipline or rules, things will go wrong.
example: If we don't set rules, everything will fall apart; cá không ăn muối cá ươn.

figurative_meaning: Luck or chance in achieving something.
example: He got lucky with that deal; it was like mèo mù vớ cá rán.

literal_meaning: Running from the sky cannot escape the sun.
example: No matter how hard you try, chạy trời không khỏi nắng; you must face the truth.

literal_meaning: To speak like a climbing dragon.
figurative_meaning: To speak in a confusing or complicated way.
example: His explanation was so complex; it was nói như rồng leo.

idiom: Lời nói không mất tiền mua
figurative_meaning: Words are easy to say but can have significant consequences.
example: Be careful what you say; lời nói không mất tiền mua.

idiom: Được ăn cả, ngã về không
literal_meaning: To gain everything or lose everything.
figurative_meaning: To take a big risk for a big reward.
example: He decided to invest all his savings; được ăn cả, ngã về không.

idiom: Bán anh em xa, mua láng giềng gần
literal_meaning: To sell distant relatives and buy nearby neighbors.
figurative_meaning: To value close relationships over distant ones.
example: He prefers to help his neighbors first; bán anh em xa, mua láng giềng gần.
